entries.meaning: The water held back by a dam or other obstruction
(idiomatic) A remote place; somewhere that remains unaffected by new events, progresses, ideas, etc.
examples: It's a volume for those who delight in exploring the backwaters of nineteenth-century opera.

entries.meaning: A rowing stroke in which the oar is pushed forward to stop the boat; see back water
(paper industry) Water used in the papermaking process. Recycled to reduce usage of fresh water, and usually containing residual amounts of chemicals and fibres.

verbs.description: backwater (third-person singular simple present backwaters, present participle backwatering, simple past and past participle backwatered)

entries.meaning: To row or paddle a backwater stroke.
(idiomatic) To vacillate on a long-held position.
